fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.charset

Interface CharsetDetectorBuilder<P>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the parent builder (when calling Parent.and() method)
    All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<CharsetDetector>, Parent<P>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleCharsetDetectorBuilder

    public interface CharsetDetectorBuilder<P>
extends Parent<P>, Builder<CharsetDetector>
    Configures NIO charset detection. A charset detector tries to detect the NIO charset used by the provided input. The charset detection is not deterministic. For a same input string, several charsets may be detected. The detector can provide the best charset or a list of possible charsets with a confidence indication.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • defaultCharset

        CharsetDetectorBuilder<P> defaultCharset(String charsetName)
        Set the default Charset that is used by the Java application.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using defaultCharset(). 

         .defaultCharset("UTF-16")
 .defaultCharset()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("UTF-8")
 
         .defaultCharset("UTF-16")
 .defaultCharset()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("UTF-8")
        In both cases, defaultCharset("UTF-16") is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        charsetName - the charset
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • defaultCharset

        ConfigurationValueBuilder<CharsetDetectorBuilder<P>,String> defaultCharset()
        Set the default Charset that is used by the Java application.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .defaultCharset()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("UTF-8")

        Non-null value set using defaultCharset(String) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .defaultCharset("UTF-16")
 .defaultCharset()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("UTF-8")
        The value "UTF-16" is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value
